poem:
**The Majestic Initiative**

Hired to outwit our raucous selves,  
Harris hawks cut the sky  
with military grace;  
chestnut-winged rangers  
patrol azure seas  
above sun-dappled terraces,  
where we breed mischief.  
Their talons frown down  
on our crumbs of hubris,  
reminding us—  
in this airborne ballet—  
that we are the true intruders  
in a world resplendent without us.
